transcript.title: Ipswich Motorway Funding Boosted To More Than $550 Million
transcript.content:
Today I am pleased to announce that the Australian Government will allocate $320 million under AusLink, over the next three-and-a-half years, to upgrade the section of the Ipswich Motorway east of Goodna to six lanes.

The widening to six lanes of the Wacol to Darra section of the motorway will include the construction of new interchanges at Progress Road and the Centenary Highway.

The Australian Government is committed to planning for a Northern Option corridor, the Goodna bypass, between Dinmore and Gailes. Three options are considered potentially feasible by engineering consultants Maunsells Australia Pty Ltd.

The Australian Government is therefore allocating an additional $10 million to undertake studies to further explore these three options for the Goodna bypass. These studies will include route selection, geo-technical investigations and environmental assessments. Details of the route options are attached.

Today's announcement boosts funds allocated to the Ipswich motorway corridor to $556 million. It builds on the Australian Government's earlier commitment of $160 million for a new interchange at the Ipswich and Logan Motorway junction and $66 million in funding for a range of interim safety works and planning along the Ipswich Motorway corridor.

Through this investment, the Australian Government is making a significant contribution to addressing congestion, safety and noise on one of south-east Queensland's busiest corridors.

Overall, the Australian Government is investing $627 million on the Ipswich Motorway and key urban Brisbane corridors through the AusLink programme.

Transport infrastructure investment of this magnitude is made possible because of the Australian Government's strong economic management. This has enabled a $12.7 billion AusLink contribution to better roads and railways in Australia during the five years to 2009.

POTENTIAL ROUTE OPTIONS FOR GOODNA BYPASS

From the Warrego Highway-Cunningham Highway junction, passing through Riverview 700 metres north of the existing motorway, skirting the Redbank railway workshops and pass across two bridges over the Brisbane River, rejoining the motorway at the Logan Motorway Interchange;

From the Warrego Highway-Cunningham Highway junction, passing over the Brisbane River from Moggill to Redbank, skirting the railway workshops before being carried on another two bridges to Priors Pocket and Wacol, rejoining the motorway at the Logan Motorway Interchange; and

From the Warrego Highway-Cunningham Highway junction, following the existing motorway and skirting the Brisbane River using viaducts in the vicinity of the railway workshops and then on two bridges to Priors Pocket and then rejoining the motorway at the Logan Motorway Interchange.
